name: St Lucia
description: St Lucia is home to UQ’s largest campus and as a result a lot of students choose to live here so they can roll out of bed and into their early-morning lectures. The campus is situated at one end of the suburb and is surrounded by the gorgeous Brisbane River on three sides.

As a result of its proximity to the city and the uni, St Lucia is an interesting mix of budget student digs and multi-million dollar riverfront homes. It is still possible however to find a great place to live, either in a share house or apartment within easy commute to campus.

The main shopping area is Hawken Village, with a supermarket, great range of shops and cheap restaurants—perfect for budget-conscious students. There’s also the almost-famous Asian supermarket on Sir Fred Schonell Drive—if you cant find what you want there, it doesn't exist!
From St Lucia you can travel really easily into the city or Valley for a night out, and the neighbouring suburbs of Toowong and Indooroopilly both offer train connec- tions and shopping malls.

One of the real charms of the suburb is the range of riverside parks and walks— most offering free barbeque facilities and WiFi. Guyatt Park is a particularly popu- lar spot for weekend parties and celebrations—just get there early to claim your spot.
Cycling is also a very popular way to get around, with a bikeway from UQ leading all the way into the city centre.
strapline: UQ's sports facilities and events on your doorstep
transport: Great bus connections exist to/from St Lucia to the city and surrounds. The CityCat ferry also has stops at UQ and Guyatt Park
shopping: There’s a smaller supermarket in Hawken Village, and larger supermarkets in neighbouring suburbs
cost: Rental prices vary...a lot! You can get a basic share for about $175 all inclusive. Naturally waterfront rentals cost a lot more...
social: If hanging at the uni bar isn't your thing you might want to head elsewhere for your night out. Try the Hawken Village restaurants for cheap eats
